Killing Floor excels as an awesome zombie killing FPS game. The multiplayer aspect of the game really challenges players to work as a team to survive waves of zombies. There are six classes to choose from (each with their own perks) that can be leveled up by completing objectives such as getting X number of headshots for the sharpshooter class. And unlike other zombies games where you mindlessly fire in all directions, you would have to work strategically with your team to defeat different types of zombies that spawn each wave. The game has 5 different difficulties, each getting exponentially harder. Zombies deals more damage, has more health, and you will receive less money to buy weapons and ammo the higher the difficulty.  

What makes this game worth buying, in my opinion, is the amount of replay value the game offers. I've logged over 300 hours playing this game, and I've never got tired of playing KF. The game is incredibly fun, especially if you manage to join a game with a group of friends. Tripwire hosts seasonal events where they release new content (such as unlockable characters, new weapons, and maps) that make players like me wanting more. The game can be difficult for beginners, but like all games, takes time to master. And when you start getting the hang of it all, you can always turn up the difficulty for a new challenge.

It's good horde-killing fun that ranges from brainless killing to actually having to get of guys together in voice chat and strategize this shit so you don't die on wave 1. The modding community is great and there's always a shitload of varied servers up, some with a shitload of custom content for them. Also you can pretty much run this game on a toaster so more than likely whatever you're using can play it. Aside from some complaints about weapons being DLC rather than regular content (among other things that are too ranty to get into), I couldn't recommend this game more. 
Critic-tier rating: 6.5/10  
IGN-tier rating: 9.5/10

Killing Floor is on the rails that most horrer/moster games stick to and thats zombies or zedz; once in game you have a few seconds before wavez of zedz start coming in and after every round you can find the merchant who will stock you for the next round that is if you have enough cash. Now while this game is just about well rounded and only has a few bugs here and there I seem to encounter the same one, if you buy a gun at about 2 or 1 second left of shop closeing it will take your money without giving you your gun and trust me no money and no good means no surviving.
let me just say, since I started playing this game I have been diagnosed with type II Diabetes.

Pros: 
Really fun, lots of maps and weapons to use, multiplayer is nice, and it seems people have made some good mods for this as well.


Cons:
Gameplay can get sort of repetitive sometimes, the rounds on "Killing Floor" mode get hard REALLY fast, and this can turn down new players from liking the game if they don't have any experience.

Overall, a great game to play with friends or alone if you're really bored.
Doesn't require a really good computer or graphics card to run on high graphics.
Lots of maps and weapons, but can sometimes get repetitive on multiplayer.

So this is an interesting story about this game. So you are hosting a Party and you invite your friends over. Your Friends invite other friends and they happend to invite this Weird guy with ripped muscles and a Glowing tatoo in his chest. You just ignore him for awhile untill you realized he invited some other friends too. Some lame pale weirdo, A guy that dresses up as a spider, a guy with a sword on his arm, A slutty chick, An Arsonist, A Fatso that keeps eating all the food, A skinny chic who has emotional problems, and a guy who loves watching chainsaw massacre too much. You ignore them for a while as they aren't casusing any problems. Then some one decided to bring in truck load of Kegs to the party and then it started to get wild. They all started wrecking the place. Chainsaw guy started sawing my furniture in two, Emotional wreck started believing she was a famous Opera singer, Sluty started going wild on the guys, Spider guy does what ever a spider does, Pale dude decided to squeal at paintings for some reason, Blade man started pretending he was a samurai and asked for chalanges, Fatso just kept eating everyting and my cleaning stuff. Arsonist was starting a bon fire in my bedroom, and Ripped Hulk Glowy was wrecking my Fine China. So I try to calm the situation down and when I tried to make a move to stop the booze. Then they turned into a jungle. They nearly knocked down the 2nd story and wrecking the place like a contained tornado. Then I decided to call the Cops and have them arrested. So a Sheriff by the name Sheriff Wade comes in gets everyting under control. He says these party wreckers will be doing their time and just as he said that the Party Wreckers looked really happy. Never seen anyone that happy to go to Jail before. So I asked how the damages will be repaired and he says the insurance should fix you up when they arrive and he hauled them off in the prison truck moved on. If you want a wild party then ask these to come over. Just make sure you have nothing to lose as I guarentee it will broken before the night ends.

Sounded great, just what I was looking for. Bought the complete pack on sale as did some friends. Started it up and tried to set up a listen server for quick games. Set it up. No one could find me. Someone else tried. We couldn't find them. Tried to set up a dedicated and it just closed down and little screen with PC gibberish appeared instead. Looked up help. It would appear you need to open a load of ports on your router and firewall and some other things if you want to set up a server. You need to have a good understandning on how a PC and routers work. No mention of that before hand before I bought it. So thats nearly £10 down the pan.


EDIT: got the server working with some friends and its pretty epic

If you happen to love killing monsters on an endless loop and listening to some pretty sick beats while you do then Killing Floor just might be for you.  Aside from killing and music there's not much to this.  I would definitely play this game with friends, otherwise you're losing half the experience.  Jump on Teamspeak or what have you and listen to the harsh screams of your friends when a fleshpound shows up and smashes their face into nothing.  Killing Floor is an experience like no other.

my friend told me i had to buy this game it is awsome so since it was on sale for complete packge i got that thinking I could use all the weapons found out that is not the case less there is somthing i have not figure out in the game other then having to buy the weapons from a merchant for a outragous price and once you get the weapon it disappears after each round and half to re purchance this tick me off.  solo player sucks  there is no real story plot  just go as many rounds as you can tell ya die lame. maybe each map has different things you can do but so far i found out they are all the same i give this game 1 star out of 5  it sucks and was a waste of my money. even though my friend stills tells me it is great  and also the graphics suck got my crank to max  and looks like old school games from the 80's  always lag on me  and for some reason even though i set it to be full screen  it always takes that off everytime i start the game up  so half to go into options every time to set to full screen and click t o keep at this mode. oh  and find out it is very hard to get in multiplayer games  i sit and wait forever just to get in a game so far very annouyed i will not buy killing floor 2 since this one sucks so bad i should of got left for dead instead that is a more fun zombie game to play i try that out at a friends house and had fun playing it and solo  has a plot to it

Я все же решил купить эту игру просто побаловаться с друзьями в кооперативке! Что я могу сказать  графика мне не важна я слава Богу не  графодрочер! Но игра чем то смахивает на такую игру как No More Room in Hell (Free to play). Но такого я не ожидал  +интересный геймплей, множество разных зомби, система прокачки и заданий, нормальный набор оружия!  - много вещей которые за DLC вот это на мой взгляд вообще бред!  Моя оценка только из-за дорогих DLC 9.5/10 но можно считать что 10/10

Dosh Simulator 2009, or "Killing Floor" to the uneducated, is a state-of-the-art dosh experience. You play as one of a wide variety of characters (be they military, police, or DLC Characters such as a DJ or a Chickenator) tasked with a simple objective: The acquisition and manipulation of dosh. 
Throw dosh in the air and then catch it.
Hurl dosh at your friends as they throw dosh at you.
Weld yourself into a room and admire your dosh.
The possibilites are endless.
Oh, and there might be a couple of experiments - but they just give you dosh.
